DataElement.preferredName: Investigational Entity Allocation Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Category Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is the assignment of an experimental unit to a portion of the study, such as an arm or a portion of an arm (when secondary allocations may occur). EXAMPLE(S): (1) randomization, direct assignment based on eligibility criteria, etc. (2) "Escalating dose cohort studies" enroll subjects in successive arms, i.e., one arm is completely filled before any subjects are enrolled in the next arm. In such a study, allocation depends on which arms have been fully enrolled and which are currently open for enrollment. Note that this example assumes that the experimental unit is the subject (rather than a part of a subject or a group of subjects). A coded value specifying a classification of activities. EXAMPLE(S): (1) In the case where category code = "anti-cancer treatment", the subcategory code may = "radiotherapy", and the name code may = "external beam radiotherapy". (2) In a procedure, category code may = "abdominal surgery". (3) In an administrative activity, the category code may = "Disposition" (off study, epoch completion), "Milestone" (informed consent, enrollment, registry, randomization) or "Other" (unblinding) activities. (4) For lab procedures, category code may = "hematology", "urinalysis", or "chemistry".

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigational Entity Allocation Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Category Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: In the process of being studied; experimental.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._This term is used informally to mean a class of things.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: In the process of being studied; experimental.
An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).
The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.

An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
